activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon S Bernstein

records.addlTxt: Michelle Erdman appointed to represent the defendant.

Preliminary hearing on November 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
NOH sent to Def at Barron Co Jail and mailed to Attorney Erdman

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must not possess any firearms.

11:26 AM Defendant Devon S Bernstein appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Devon S Bernstein.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
COVERS 22CF199, 22CF201, 22CF244 & 22CF245

22CF199 & 22CF201- Reading of Information waived. 
NG pleas entered to each count in both cases.  
Bond to continue. 
Status hearing 12/7/22 10:00 am 

22CF244 & 22CF245-Attorney Erdman relates and waives further reading.
DE to contact PD office to have Attorney Erdman appointed on this case.
Attorney Erdman waives time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Preliminary hearing 11/17/22 3:30 pm before Judge Bitney 
Court orders $2500.00 Signature bond in each case with condition of Must not possess any firearms.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
